titleStmt.title: The true mayde of the south: or, A rare example of a maide dvvelling at Rie in Sussex, who for the loue of a young man of Lester-shire, went beyond sea in the habit of a page, and after, to their hearts content, were both marryed at Magrum in Germany, and now dwelling at Rye aforesaid. To the tune of, Come, come my sweet and bonny one.

notesStmt.note: Verse: "VVithin the hauen towne of Rye ..."
In two parts, separated for mounting; woodcut at head of first part.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
